p: There is no cure for ALS, and current drug treatment is limited since only two drugs are approved by the Food and Drug Administration for the treatment of the disease: Riluzole, a neuroprotective drug that blocks glutamatergic neurotransmission and, more recently, the antioxidant drug Edaravone. These assist in delaying the progression of the disease, extending life expectancy by 2-3 months [ 2, 17].
